Affinity.description:
Affinity is a group of affinity scheduling rules.
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/#affinity-and-anti-affinity

nodeAffinity.description: Describes node affinity scheduling rules for the pod.

podAffinity.description: Describes pod affinity scheduling rules (e.g. co-locate this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s)).

podAntiAffinity.description: Describes pod anti-affinity scheduling rules (e.g. avoid putting this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s)).

Affinity.title: Affinity

label.description: Custom identifier belonging to a topic; define only if `type` is `pattern` or `None`
label.title: Label

HelmApp.description: Kubernetes app managed through Helm with an associated Helm chart.

from.description: Topic(s) and/or components from which the component will read input
from.title: From

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace in which the component shall be deployed
namespace.title: Namespace

prefix.description: Pipeline prefix that will prefix every component name. If you wish to not have any prefix you can specify an empty string.
prefix.title: Prefix

repo_config.description: Configuration of the Helm chart repo to be used for deploying the component

to.description: Topic(s) into which the component will write output

HelmApp.title: HelmApp

fullnameOverride.description: Helm chart fullname override, assigned automatically
fullnameOverride.title: FullnameOverride

nameOverride.description: Helm chart name override, assigned automatically
nameOverride.title: NameOverride

ignore.description: List of keypaths that should be excluded from the diff.
ignore.title: Ignore

ImagePullPolicy.description:
Represents the different Kubernetes image pull policies.

https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#image-pull-policy
ImagePullPolicy.title: ImagePullPolicy

InputTopicTypes.description:
Input topic types.

- INPUT: input topic
- PATTERN: extra-topic-pattern or input-topic-pattern
InputTopicTypes.title: InputTopicTypes

enabled.description: Whether or not to open JMX port for remote access (e.g., for debugging)
enabled.title: Enabled

host.description: The host to use for JMX remote access.
host.title: Host

port.description: The JMX port which JMX style metrics are exposed.
port.title: Port

attrNameSnakeCase.description: Converts the attribute name to snake case. This is seen in the names matched by the pattern and the default format. For example, anAttrName to an_attr_name.
attrNameSnakeCase.title: Attrnamesnakecase

cache.description: Whether to cache bean name expressions to rule computation (match and mismatch). Not recommended for rules matching on bean value, as only the value from the first scrape will be cached and re-used. This can increase performance when collecting a lot of mbeans.
cache.title: Cache

help.description: Help text for the metric. Capture groups from pattern can be used. name must be set to use this. Defaults to the mBean attribute description, domain, and name of the attribute.
help.title: Help

labels.description: A map of label name to label value pairs. Capture groups from pattern can be used in each. name must be set to use this. Empty names and values are ignored. If not specified and the default format is not being used, no labels are set.
labels.title: Labels

name.description: The metric name to set. Capture groups from the pattern can be used. If not specified, the default format will be used. If it evaluates to empty, processing of this attribute stops with no output. An Additional suffix may be added to this name (e.g _total for type COUNTER)
name.title: Name

pattern.description: Regex pattern to match against each bean attribute. The pattern is not anchored. Capture groups can be used in other options. Defaults to matching everything.
pattern.title: Pattern

type.description: The type of the metric. name must be set to use this.

value.description: Value for the metric. Static values and capture groups from the pattern can be used. If not specified the scraped mBean value will be used.
value.title: Value

valueFactor.description: Optional number that value (or the scraped mBean value if value is not specified) is multiplied by, mainly used to convert mBean values from milliseconds to seconds.
valueFactor.title: Valuefactor

maxRAMPercentage.description: Sets the maximum amount of memory that the JVM may use for the Java heap before applying ergonomics heuristics as a percentage of the maximum amount determined as described in the -XX:MaxRAM option
maxRAMPercentage.title: Maxrampercentage

others.description: List of Java VM options passed to the streams app.
others.title: Others

from.description: Topic(s) and/or components from which the component will read input
from.title: From

prefix.description: Pipeline prefix that will prefix every component name. If you wish to not have any prefix you can specify an empty string.
prefix.title: Prefix

to.description: Topic(s) into which the component will write output

resetter_namespace.title: Resetter Namespace

resetter_values.description: Overriding Kafka Connect resetter Helm values, e.g. to override the image tag etc.

to.description: Topic(s) into which the component will write output

KubernetesApp.description:
Base class for all Kubernetes apps.
All built-in components are Kubernetes apps, except for the Kafka connectors.

from.description: Topic(s) and/or components from which the component will read input
from.title: From

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace in which the component shall be deployed
namespace.title: Namespace

prefix.description: Pipeline prefix that will prefix every component name. If you wish to not have any prefix you can specify an empty string.
prefix.title: Prefix

to.description: Topic(s) into which the component will write output

KubernetesApp.title: KubernetesApp

LabelSelector.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
matchExpressions.title: Matchexpressions

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is *key*, the operator is *In*, and the values array contains only *value*. The requirements are ANDed.
matchLabels.title: Matchlabels

LabelSelector.title: LabelSelector

LabelSelectorOperator.description: Operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.
LabelSelectorOperator.title: LabelSelectorOperator

LabelSelectorRequirement.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.
key.title: Key

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.
values.title: Values

LabelSelectorRequirement.title: LabelSelectorRequirement

NodeAffinity.description: Node affinity is a group of node affinity scheduling rules.

preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringEx.description: The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding *weight* to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringEx.title: Preferredduringschedulingignoredduringexecution

requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExe.description: If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to an update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node.

NodeAffinity.title: NodeAffinity

NodeSelector.description: A node selector represents the union of the results of one or more label queries over a set of nodes; that is, it represents the OR of the selectors represented by the node selector terms.

nodeSelectorTerms.description: A list of node selector terms. The terms are ORed.
nodeSelectorTerms.title: Nodeselectorterms

NodeSelector.title: NodeSelector

NodeSelectorOperator.description: Represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist. Gt, and Lt.
NodeSelectorOperator.title: NodeSelectorOperator

NodeSelectorRequirement.description: A node selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.
key.title: Key

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. If the operator is Gt or Lt, the values array must have a single element, which will be interpreted as an integer. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.
values.title: Values

NodeSelectorRequirement.title: NodeSelectorRequirement

NodeSelectorTerm.description: A null or empty node selector term matches no objects. The requirements of them are ANDed. The TopologySelectorTerm type implements a subset of the NodeSelectorTerm.

matchExpressions.description: A list of node selector requirements by node's labels.
matchExpressions.title: Matchexpressions

matchFields.description: A list of node selector requirements by node's fields.
matchFields.title: Matchfields

NodeSelectorTerm.title: NodeSelectorTerm

OutputTopicTypes.description:
Types of output topic.

- OUTPUT: output topic
- ERROR: error topic
OutputTopicTypes.title: OutputTopicTypes

from.description: Topic(s) and/or components from which the component will read input
from.title: From

prefix.description: Pipeline prefix that will prefix every component name. If you wish to not have any prefix you can specify an empty string.
prefix.title: Prefix

to.description: Topic(s) into which the component will write output

PodAffinity.description: Pod affinity is a group of inter pod affinity scheduling rules.

preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringEx.description: The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding weight to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringEx.title: Preferredduringschedulingignoredduringexecution

requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExe.description: If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied.
requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExe.title: Requiredduringschedulingignoredduringexecution

PodAffinity.title: PodAffinity

PodAffinityTerm.description: Defines a set of pods (namely those matching the labelSelector relative to the given namespace(s)) that this pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key <topologyKey> matches that of any node on which a pod of the set of pods is running.

labelSelector.description: A label query over a set of resources, in this case pods. If it's null, this PodAffinityTerm matches with no Pods.

matchLabelKeys.description: MatchLabelKeys is a set of pod label keys to select which pods will be taken into consideration. The keys are used to lookup values from the incoming pod labels, those key-value labels are merged with `labelSelector` as `key in (value)` to select the group of existing pods which pods will be taken into consideration for the incoming pod's pod (anti) affinity. Keys that don't exist in the incoming pod labels will be ignored. The default value is empty. The same key is forbidden to exist in both matchLabelKeys and labelSelector. Also, matchLabelKeys cannot be set when labelSelector isn't set. This is a beta field and requires enabling MatchLabelKeysInPodAffinity feature gate (enabled by default).
matchLabelKeys.title: Matchlabelkeys

mismatchLabelKeys.description: MismatchLabelKeys is a set of pod label keys to select which pods will be taken into consideration. The keys are used to lookup values from the incoming pod labels, those key-value labels are merged with `labelSelector` as `key notin (value)` to select the group of existing pods which pods will be taken into consideration for the incoming pod's pod (anti) affinity. Keys that don't exist in the incoming pod labels will be ignored. The default value is empty. The same key is forbidden to exist in both mismatchLabelKeys and labelSelector. Also, mismatchLabelKeys cannot be set when labelSelector isn't set. This is a beta field and requires enabling MatchLabelKeysInPodAffinity feature gate (enabled by default).
mismatchLabelKeys.title: Mismatchlabelkeys

namespaceSelector.description: A label query over the set of namespaces that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces selected by this field and the ones listed in the namespaces field. null selector and null or empty namespaces list means *this pod's namespace*. An empty selector ({}) matches all namespaces.

topologyKey.description: This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed. :param: namespaces: namespaces specifies a static list of namespace names that the term applies to. The term is applied to the union of the namespaces listed in this field and the ones selected by namespaceSelector. null or empty namespaces list and null namespaceSelector means *this pod's namespace*.
topologyKey.title: Topologykey

PodAffinityTerm.title: PodAffinityTerm

PortConfig.description: Base class for the port configuration of the Kafka Streams application.

name.description: Services can reference port by name (optional).
name.title: Name

schema.description: Protocol for port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP.

servicePort.description: Number of the port of the service (optional)
servicePort.title: Serviceport

PortConfig.title: PortConfig

PreferredSchedulingTerm.description: An empty preferred scheduling term matches all objects with implicit weight 0 (i.e. it's a no-op). A null preferred scheduling term matches no objects (i.e. is also a no-op).

preference.description: A node selector term, associated with the corresponding weight.

weight.description: Weight associated with matching the corresponding nodeSelectorTerm, in the range 1-100.
weight.title: Weight

PreferredSchedulingTerm.title: PreferredSchedulingTerm

ProducerApp.description:
Producer component.
This producer holds configuration to use as values for the streams-bootstrap producer Helm chart. Note that the producer does not support error topics.

to.description: Topic(s) into which the component will write output

backoffLimit.description: The number of times to restart an unsuccessful job.

commandLine.description: Map of command line arguments passed to the streams app.

configurationEnvPrefix.description: Prefix for environment variables to use that should be parsed as command line arguments.

deployment.description: Deploy the producer as a Kubernetes Deployment (thereby ignoring Job-related configurations)

failedJobsHistoryLimit.description: The number of unsuccessful jobs to retain.

files.description: Map of files to mount for the app. File will be mounted as $value.mountPath/$key. $value.content denotes file content (recommended to be used with --set-file).
files.title: Files

fullnameOverride.description: Helm chart fullname override, assigned automatically

schedule.description: Cron expression to denote a schedule this producer app should be run on. It will then be deployed as a CronJob instead of a Job.
schedule.title: Schedule

secretRefs.description: Inject existing secrets as environment variables. Map key is used as environment variable name. Value consists of secret name and key.
secretRefs.title: Secretrefs

secrets.description: Custom secret environment variables. Prefix with configurationEnvPrefix in order to pass secrets to command line or prefix with KAFKA_ to pass secrets to Kafka Streams configuration.

successfulJobsHistoryLimit.description: The number of successful jobs to retain.

suspend.description: Whether to suspend the execution of the cron job.
suspend.title: Suspend

tolerations.description: Array containing taint references. When defined, pods can run on nodes, which would otherwise deny scheduling.
tolerations.title: Tolerations

key.description: The key that the toleration applies to.
key.title: Key

tolerationSeconds.description: The duration for which the toleration is valid.
tolerationSeconds.title: Tolerationseconds

value.description: The value to match for the key.
value.title: Value

label.description: Custom identifier belonging to one or multiple topics, provide only if `type` is `extra`
label.title: Label

partitions_count.description: Number of partitions into which the topic is divided
partitions_count.title: Partitions count

WeightedPodAffinityTerm.description: The weights of all of the matched WeightedPodAffinityTerm fields are added per-node to find the most preferred node(s).

podAffinityTerm.description: A pod affinity term, associated with the corresponding weight.

weight.description: weight associated with matching the corresponding podAffinityTerm, in the range 1-100.
weight.title: Weight

WeightedPodAffinityTerm.title: WeightedPodAffinityTerm

kpops__components__streams_bootstrap__st.description:
streams-bootstrap persistence configurations.

:param enabled: Whether to use a persistent volume to store the state of the streams app.
:param size: The size of the PersistentVolume to allocate to each streams pod in the StatefulSet.
:param storage_class: Storage class to use for the persistent volume.

enabled.description: Whether to use a persistent volume to store the state of the streams app.
enabled.title: Enabled

size.description: The size of the PersistentVolume to allocate to each streams pod in the StatefulSet.
size.title: Size

storage_class.description: Storage class to use for the persistent volume.
storage_class.title: Storage Class

kpops__components__streams_bootstrap__st.title: PersistenceConfig

additionalTriggers.description: List of additional KEDA triggers, see https://keda.sh/docs/latest/scalers/
additionalTriggers.title: Additionaltriggers

cooldownPeriod.description: The period to wait after the last trigger reported active before scaling the resource back to 0. https://keda.sh/docs/2.9/concepts/scaling-deployments/#cooldownperiod
cooldownPeriod.title: Cooldown period

enabled.description: Whether to enable auto-scaling using KEDA.
enabled.title: Enabled

idleReplicas.description: If this property is set, KEDA will scale the resource down to this number of replicas. https://keda.sh/docs/2.9/concepts/scaling-deployments/#idlereplicacount
idleReplicas.title: Idle replica count

internalTopics.description: List of auto-generated Kafka Streams topics used by the streams app
internalTopics.title: Internaltopics

lagThreshold.description: Average target value to trigger scaling actions. Mandatory to set when auto-scaling is enabled.
lagThreshold.title: Lag threshold

maxReplicas.description: This setting is passed to the HPA definition that KEDA will create for a given resource and holds the maximum number of replicas of the target resouce. https://keda.sh/docs/2.9/concepts/scaling-deployments/#maxreplicacount
maxReplicas.title: Max replica count

minReplicas.description: Minimum number of replicas KEDA will scale the resource down to. "https://keda.sh/docs/2.9/concepts/scaling-deployments/#minreplicacount"
minReplicas.title: Min replica count

offsetResetPolicy.description: The offset reset policy for the consumer if the consumer group is not yet subscribed to a partition.
offsetResetPolicy.title: Offset reset policy

pollingInterval.description: This is the interval to check each trigger on. https://keda.sh/docs/2.9/concepts/scaling-deployments/#pollinginterval
pollingInterval.title: Polling interval

topics.description: List of topics used by the streams app
topics.title: Topics

applicationId.description: Unique application ID for Kafka Streams. Required for auto-scaling
applicationId.title: Unique application ID

deleteOutput.description: Whether the output topics with their associated schemas and the consumer group should be deleted during the cleanup
deleteOutput.title: Deleteoutput

consumerGroup.title: Consumer group

cooldownPeriod.title: Cooldown period

idleReplicas.title: Idle replica count

lagThreshold.title: Lag threshold

maxReplicas.description: This setting is passed to the HPA definition that KEDA will create for a given resource and holds the maximum number of replicas of the target resouce. https://keda.sh/docs/2.9/concepts/scaling-deployments/#maxreplicacount
maxReplicas.title: Max replica count

minReplicas.description: Minimum number of replicas KEDA will scale the resource down to. "https://keda.sh/docs/2.9/concepts/scaling-deployments/#minreplicacount"
minReplicas.title: Min replica count

offsetResetPolicy.description: The offset reset policy for the consumer if the consumer group is not yet subscribed to a partition.
offsetResetPolicy.title: Offset reset policy

pollingInterval.description: This is the interval to check each trigger on. https://keda.sh/docs/2.9/concepts/scaling-deployments/#pollinginterval
pollingInterval.title: Polling interval
